class_notes:
This is a one-credit course that provides students an opportunity to lead and promote a deeper understanding of sustainable food and ecological justice among the members of the Emory Community at large. This course enables students to learn about and engage with like-minded individuals within the Atlanta food and beverage industry, local farmers and other specialists committed to sustainable food production practices. Tasking the students with the execution of this project will allow them to further their leadership skills, demonstrate their commitment to sustainability and enable them to become agents of social change. 
The class meets on Mondays and Wednesday from 4:00 to 5:15pm. Last day of class is October 6th, 2021
The Sustainable Food Fair is supported by the Emory Office of Sustainability Initiative.  
This class is suitable for First Year students.
course_description: Highly focused courses, drawing on multiple disciplines of the humanities and social sciences; may be repeated for credit when topics vary.
